org.eclipse.viatra.dse.objectives

Interface IGlobalConstraint

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModelQueriesGlobalConstraint

    public interface IGlobalConstraint
    Implementation of this interface represents a global constraint of the DSE problem, which can halt an exploration continuing from a state which dissatisfies the global constraint.

    Certain global constraints can have inner state for the validation. In this case a new instance is necessary for every new thread, and the createNew method should not return the same instance more than once.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkGlobalConstraint(ThreadContext context)
      Checks whether the current state satisfies the global constraint.
      IGlobalConstraint createNew()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the global constraint.
        Returns:
        The name of the global constraint.

      • checkGlobalConstraint

        boolean checkGlobalConstraint(ThreadContext context)
        Checks whether the current state satisfies the global constraint.
        Parameters:
        context - The ThreadContext which contains the necessary information.
        Returns:
        True if the state is valid and exploration can be continued from the actual state.

      • init

        void init(ThreadContext context)
        Initializes the global constraint. It is called exactly once for every thread starts.
        Parameters:
        context - The ThreadContext.

      • createNew

        IGlobalConstraint createNew()
        Returns an instance of the IGlobalConstraint. If it returns the same instance, all the methods has to be thread save as they are called concurrently.
        Returns:
        An instance of the global constraint.
